intro: Echites denticulatus, commonly known as the toothed echites, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Echites denticulatus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
